mapper.select: SELECT o.id, orderNo, orderDate, totalNumber, totalPrice, bankAccountId, remark, editStatus, cancelStatus, o.createBy, o.updateBy, o.updateDate, b.bandCount AS bankAccountName, c.userName AS createByName, u.userName AS updateByName FROM xs_order o LEFT JOIN sys_user c ON o.createBy = c.userId AND c.isDel = 0 LEFT JOIN sys_user u ON o.updateBy = u.userId AND u.isDel = 0 JOIN bank_account b ON o.bankAccountId = b.id AND b.isDel = 0 WHERE o.isDelete = 0 and o.type=0 and editStatus=1 and orderNo like concat('%',#{orderNo},'%') and o.orderDate between #{orderDateBegin} and #{orderDateEnd} and o.createBy=#{createBy} order by orderDate DESC

SELECT o.id, orderNo, orderDate, totalNumber, totalPrice, bankAccountId, remark, refundTypeId, isCheck, opinion, o.createBy, o.updateBy, o.updateDate, c.userName AS createByName, ba.bandCount AS bankAccountName, ba.`name`, ba.belongBank FROM xs_order o,sys_user c,bank_account ba WHERE o.createBy = c.userId and o.bankAccountId=ba.id and o.isDelete = 0 and c.isDel=0 and ba.isDel=0 and orderNo=#{orderNo}

select b.id,b.name,b.categoryId,b.unitId,b.salePrice,b.specification,b.warning, un.name as unitName,mc.name as categoryName,om.medicineId,om.quantity,om.totalPrice,om.batchCode,kc.quantity as stock, c.userName AS createByName,u.userName AS updateByName,b.createTime,b.updateTime from base_unit un,base_medicine_category mc,order_medicine om,kc_medicine kc,base_medicine b LEFT JOIN sys_user c ON b.createBy = c.userId AND c.isDel = 0 LEFT JOIN sys_user u ON b.updateBy = u.userId AND u.isDel = 0 where b.categoryId=mc.id and b.unitId=un.id and b.id=om.medicineId and kc.batchCode=om.batchCode and kc.medicineId=om.medicineId and b.isDel=0 and un.isDel=0 and mc.isDel=0 and om.isDel=0 and om.code=#{orderNo}
mapper.update: update order_medicine set isDel=1 where code=#{orderNo}
update order_medicine set isCancel=1 where code=#{orderNo}
